subject: Cybersecurity
title: Red Teaming: Hiring Hackers to Test Your People
description: A fast breakdown of Red Teaming: Hiring Hackers to Test Your People for builders.

hook.text: A company pays someone to break into its own building, trick its employees, and steal its secrets â€” on purpose.

buildup.text: Red teams test an organization's defenses using the same techniques real attackers would.

discovery.text: Social engineering red teams craft phishing campaigns, make vishing calls, and attempt physical intrusion.

twist.text: Red team findings are often humbling. Even security-conscious organizations fail at least some social engineering tests.

climax.text: The only way to know if your defenses work is to test them against someone trying to break them.

punchline.text: The best way to find your weakness is to hire someone to exploit it.

quiz.question: What does a social engineering red team do?
options: Tests human defenses using real attack techniques
